subject: Re: Alphabetical Order
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> Anthony Grahn wrote:
> >
> o would not be affected.
> >
> > For clarity I've put together this file:
> >
> >
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Pronunciation/fig5.jpg
> >
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Pronunciation/fig5.jpg>
> >
>
>So which lexical set does "bomb" belong to? For myself, I could put it
>in either the LOT or the THOUGHT set, but not in the PALM set. My
>Longhorn dictionary puts it in the PALM set, however, which means it
>should be spelled with Ah, and that looks odd to me.
>

The proposal is really just this: everything that sounds like "palm"
("father, llama, lava") uses #32Ah, everything that does not sound
like "palm" uses #33Awe. This means that some accents would use Awe
for 2 different (albeit similar) sounds.

"bomb" does not sound like "palm" for you so the proposal would mean
using Awe.
Longhorn will use Ah for "palm" even without this proposal so nothing
changes there.


>
>Also, under the current scheme, British have a different set for LOT and
>THOUGHT. Under the new schemed, the merge these two. But I thought most
>British keep these sets separate?
>

Indeed many do. But QS is not anything like phonetic, indeed some
letters already cover multiple phonemes, this suggestion adds one
more such case.


>
>I didn't want to bring this up earlier, but now seems the place for it.
>We could also get rid of either Wool or Ooze.
>

Yes they are unnecessary and indeed most other spelling reform
projects merge them. But having those letter seems quite harmless as
you also point out. Since I have a tendency to hold the QM as
sacrosanct (so much so that my proposal about changing the nature of
Ox makes me physical ill) I must admit that if we got rid innocent
Wool and Ooze, I'd surely burst into tears.
